briefTitle: Neostigmine Treatment of Acute Pancreatitis Combined With Intra-abdominal Hypertension
officialTitle: The Curative Effect and Security of Neostigmine Treatment of Acute Pancreatitis Combined With Intra-abdominal Hypertension

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

primary.measure: Percent Change of IAP After Treatment
primary.description: Monitor the intra-abdominal pressure within 1 to 7 days after randomization, and calculate the percent change compared with that before randomization
primary.timeFrame: From randomization to 7 days after treatment,Measured IAP every 6 hours

secondary.measure: The Change of Stool Volume at 1-7 Days After Randomization
secondary.description: After randomization, the change of stool volume (ML) was calculated every 24 hours.For example, the amount of stool volume decreased or increased in 24 hours after grouping compared to before grouping.
Abdominal compartment syndrome is defined as a sustained IAP\>20 mmHg (with or without an APP\<60 mmHg) that is associated with new organ dysfunction/failure
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization to discharge or death, assessed up to 4 weeks

secondary.description: Incidence of organ failure from randomization to discharge or death, assessed up to 3 months
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization to discharge or death, assessed up to 3 months

secondary.description: Death during from randomization to 90 days after onset.
secondary.timeFrame: From randomization to 90 days after onset.

secondary.description: From date of randomization to enteral nutrition, assessed up to 30 days
secondary.timeFrame: Start time of enteral nutrition after randomization, assessed up to 30 days

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Deterioration of IAH
secondary.description: IAP rebound ≥ 5mmHg or increase ≥ 20mmHg within 1-7 days after grouping

secondary.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Effects on the Cardiovascular System
secondary.description: Due to that neostigmine has an inhibitory effect on the cardiovascular system, new-onset cardiovascular failure after grouping is considered as a possible adverse event related to neostigmine.Cardiovascular failure was defined as circulatory systolic blood pressure \<90 mm Hg, despite adequate fluid resuscitation, or need for inotropic catecholamine support

other.description: Days in hospital within 6 months after randomisation
Days in ICU within 6 months after randomisation
Medical expenses within 6 months after randomisation
